data.title: Make Enter Default Accept Key For"Ok", "Choose", "Create", Etc For All UI Dialogs In Editor
data.body:
**Operating system or device - Godot version:**
Linux, Godot 2.0.2

**Issue description** (what happened, and what was expected):
It's a bit unfluid to have some UI dialogs acceptable (Ok button, Create, or Choose button) by hitting the enter key and not others. The only alternative is to tab until the button is highlighted and then hit enter.

**Steps to reproduce:**
Hit enter on some dialogs and they do nothing.

**Link to minimal example project** (optional but very welcome):

data.title: No Code Completion For Instanced Nodes
data.body:
**Operating system or device - Godot version:**
Linux, Godot 2.0.3

**Issue description** (what happened, and what was expected):
I just learned to instance nodes from saved scenes and I expected code completion for it but there was none.

**Steps to reproduce:**
Instance a scene and create a node from it.

data.title: When making a node add itself to a group via script, self is required before add_to group()
data.body:
**Operating system or device - Godot version:**
Windows - 2.0.3

**Issue description** (what happened, and what was expected):
when making a node add itself to a group, you need to specify self.add_to group("whatever") instead of just add_to group("whatever"), this can be confusing as usually self is implied if there is no target (or whatever you call the thing you are calling the function on) before the function

**Steps to reproduce:**
attempt to make a node add itself to a group via script, using only add_to group("whatever") instead of self.add_to group("whatever")
test node for group membership

data.title: Vibration support
data.body:
I need a better feedback in my game for mobile version, but I didn't found a way to make the phone vibrate using vanilla Godot.
There is currently a module for Android: https://github.com/literaldumb/GodotVibrate
I think something that simple should be included in the engine.

data.title: Project Autoload On Export To Home Folder On Linux
data.body:
**Operating system or device - Godot version:**
Linux, Godot version 2.0.3

**Issue description** (what happened, and what was expected):
I exported my project to my home directory and on next load of Godot it loads and runs my project instead of bringing up the project manager and editor.

**Steps to reproduce:**
Export an X11 to your project folder. Load Godot. My Godot executable is in /usr/bin, I don't know if that has anything to do with it.

**Link to minimal example project** (optional but very welcome):

data.title: Error 3D physics, violation collision mesh RigidBody and other body
data.body:
Linux Mint 17.3 Cinnamon, Godot 2.0.3

Error 3D physics, violation collision mesh RigidBody and other body

I was faced with a problem: the failure of border collision meshes. This leads to the fact that the objects with the body of type RigidBody falls through other objects.

I tried to upload a collision mesh from Blender (-colonly) and created it in the Godot [link](http://www.godotengine.org/qa/4076/why-is-the-object-barrel-rigidbody-doesnt-stay-on-terraina) Unloaded from the Blender collision meshes don't work at all, collision meshes created in Godot are working with an error.

Maybe I did something wrong. So I asked council: [link](http://www.godotengine.org/qa/4186/problems-with-physics-and-rigidbody)
Apparently nobody knows how to fix this error.

I experimented and found a compromise solution. I have not uploaded a collision mesh from Blender and created in Godot: "BoxShape", "CapsuleShape", etc. It reduces the symptoms error of physics.
It is obvious that it is often not acceptable. This approach does not allow to fully develop a game with modern graphics.

Additionally I have studied third-party example [link](https://github.com/gokudomatic/godot_fps_crawler). And it turned out that there is also a problem with physics. Possible using a weapon to throw the enemy outside the game cards (for this purpose it is necessary to pinch in the corner and intensively to attack). Also using mines and being against the wall you can throw the player outside the playing card (game character).

Summing up, I think it's a problem in the physics engine. I think this is a very serious problem when creating a 3D game with interactive space.

data.title: [WIP/RFC] Fix calling XMapWindow before XSetClassHint
data.body:
Add new context CONTEXT_PLAYER, move the XMapWindow call to the
set_context function in os_x11.cpp. Add another set_context call for
when you hit the play button.

Resolves #4827 

**NOTE:** This pull request really needs to be reviewed/tested as it might lead to other bugs. There might also be better ways of doing this than what I have done here.

data.title: add "export all resources into SELECTED directories"
data.body:
**Operating system or device - Godot version:**
official 2.0.3stable

**Issue description** (what happened, and what was expected):
When exporting a project, the editor currently offers these 3 methods regarding resources : 
1. Export selected resources (including dependencies)
2. Export all resources into the project.
3. Export all files in the project directory.

The first option requires you to select EACH file one after each other, and there is no way to select ALL the resources that are contained into a directory.

It could be cool it was possible to apply a default action ("export" or "bundle" or "--") to all the files contained into a directory.

**Steps to reproduce:**

**Link to minimal example project** (optional but very welcome):

data.title: XMapWindow happens before XSetClassHint
data.body:
**Operating system or device - Godot version:**
Arch Linux using the bsp window manager.

**Issue description** (what happened, and what was expected):
For most window managers/desktop environments to be able to execute or apply rules to specific programs, they need to have access to the window class/name when the program is mapped, this is not happening as the class hints are set after the mapping.

**Steps to reproduce:**
Install bspwm and try to apply this rule:
`bspc rule -a "Godot:*" state=floating`
Then start godot. The rule is not being applied.

**Link to minimal example project** (optional but very welcome):
Referring to the issue I opened on bspwm baskerville/bspwm#493

data.title: Support vector images
data.body: It would be very nice to support vector images in godot engines (import svg or swf file).

data.title: Ability to rename autoloads
data.body:
This PR makes the 'Name' field of autoloads editable, with support
for undo/redo. Name clashes/invalid characters are handled. Fixes #3481.

I used the _action_edited function (which renames input actions) as a base for some of the logic, and I think I've tested the functionnality pretty thoroughly, no errors, undo/redo works, the autoloads' order is preserved... should be good!

data.title: Fix crash when redoing backspace to clear selection
data.body:
Fixes a crash that would occur if you tried to redo a backspaced selection.

related to #4818

data.title: Added breakpoint markers, issue 4750
data.body:
Added an optional gutter for drawing breakpoint markers. You can click the gutter to toggle the breakpoint on that line. Lastly, It changes the cursor to `CURSOR_ARROW` when hovering over the gutter and line numbers. 

It looks like the following image: 

![breakpoint_gutter_final](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/6584330/15575907/264d14ac-234d-11e6-82a5-1e2ded68bb18.png)

closes #4750

data.title: sometimes, the 3d viewport size is corrupted after the window was reduced
data.body:
**Operating system or device - Godot version:**
Official 2.0.3stable win64
Windows 8.1
GPU AMD Radeon R7

**Issue description** (what happened, and what was expected):

Sometimes, when I resize the editor's window while displaying the 3d viewport, the content of the 3d viewport is wrongly rescaled. Pixels become gigantic, and the center of the viewport is not visible (outside the viewport)

There is no way to restore correct scale to the viewport, except quitting and opening again.

data.title: Ability to maximize cetain panels
data.body:
Proposing the following:
- A new icon on the right side of certain panels will enable  2D, 3D, Script, FileSystem browser panels to be  maximized (to occupy the entire window) or minimize (return them to default normal behaviour). Perhaps starting Godot via terminal with the switch`-editor`should open Godot in Script mode with the Script editor panel maximized.

data.title: Godot UI suddenly exits (crash to desktop)
data.body:
**Operating system or device - Godot version:**
Windows 10 - Godot 2.0.3 (not Steam)

**Issue description** (what happened, and what was expected):
Occasionally Godot editor disappears without warning while editing a script. If I happen to have my app running at the time, both it and the Godot DOS box remain. The last time this happened I captured the last few lines before the crash. I'm not sure of the relevance, but it's here anyway:

```
ERROR: Object::emit_signal: Error calling method from signal 'breaked': 'ScriptEditor::_breaked': Expected 2 arguments.
   At: core\object.cpp:1210
*User switched to another app*
ERROR: Object::emit_signal: Error calling method from signal 'breaked': 'ScriptEditor::_breaked': Expected 2 arguments.
   At: core\object.cpp:1210
shit?: No error
ERROR: StreamPeerWinsock::read: Server disconnected!

   At: platform\windows\stream_peer_winsock.cpp:210

```

The asterisked line is debugging output from my app.

**Steps to reproduce:**
Unfortunately the error is not easily reproduced, but the one common theme is that it seems to happen when I'm undoing/redoing code in the script editor. This has happened a number of times now (at least 1/2 dozen) and I'm also pretty sure it wasn't happening like this in earlier versions. I'm a pretty heavy undo/redo user so I would've noticed it in earlier versions. Sorry to be vague.

**Link to minimal example project** (optional but very welcome):
Not relevant due to nature of the issue.

data.title: PRIMITIVE_ constants should be removed from Mesh (they are in VisualServer already)
data.body: PRIMITIVE_ constants should be removed from Mesh since they seem to already exist in VisualServer which has all the opengl constants

data.title: Imported materials are not colour corrected
data.body:
**Operating system or device - Godot version:**
Godot 2.0.3 Stable

**Issue description** (what happened, and what was expected):
When you import a 3D scene containing a mesh with a material applied to it, the saturation of that material will not be right on import (seemingly always waaay too saturated)

**Steps to reproduce:**
Import a 3D scene with a material with low saturation, observe the result.

**Link to minimal example project**
You can simply export this blend file and import it into Godot. In blender you'll notice the side using textures is almost perfectly identical to the side using solid materials, but upon importing into Godot, the solid material side is far more saturated than the texture coloured side. 

https://drive.google.com/file/d/0BxAUmolQ9DxLM0dsREwxUTg4V0k/view?usp=drivesdk

data.title: Debugger: show error message if description is not available
data.body:
Since a description of the error is not always provided, we show the error message instead in those situations. WDYT?

Would close #4805

data.title: Batch-exporting projects from the editor
data.body:
It would be very nice to have something that lets you export for several platforms and architectures at once; this could speed up the project release process considerably, without relying on platform-specific command lines. It could be part of the Export dialog (with an additional "Batch Export" tab) and look like a list of checkboxes like this:

---
- [ ] Windows
  - [ ] Windows 64-bit
  - [ ] Windows 32-bit
- [ ] Linux
  - [ ] Linux 64-bit
  - [ ] Linux 32-bit
- 

---

Ticking the checkbox next to the operating system would enable it for all architectures at once, but the user could also choose to export for one architecture only.

There would probably be a global CheckButton for toggling debugging on all the exports. The naming scheme would probably follow the default SCons one, ideally it would be customizable as well.

data.title: ScriptEditor/ShaderEditor: Replace find/replace dialog with a bar
data.body:
This Pull Request replaces the find/replace dialog with a find/replace bar. It has the same features as the dialog but with usability improvements. It also highlights all occurrences (based on @Paulb23's word highlighting).

I also added _Find Previous_ to the _Search_ menu, with the hotkey <kbd>SHIFT</kbd>+<kbd>F3</kbd>.

The _FindReplaceDialog_ was not removed, but it's no longer used. I would like to use it for a _Find In Files_/_Find All_ dialog in the future.

**Note:** I did some changes to `CodeEditor`. It inherits `VBoxContainer` now instead of `Control`. The error label and the _line:col_ label are now contained in an `HBoxContainer` and a `MarginContainer` (which is what I needed #4096 for).

Some screenshots:

![Screenshot 1](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/7718100/15554283/ae54be2a-22c3-11e6-936c-20d9a25c7066.png)
![Screenshot 2](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/7718100/15554284/ae65acd0-22c3-11e6-813c-3150f9caeeba.png)

data.title: RichTextLabel: Add meta interactive feature
data.body:
This pull request adds a public method `set_meta_interactive(true)` that enables a `meta_mouse_hovering` signal that can be used. (For RichTextLabels)
Default value is false.

For example, we have the `meta_click signal` already. This pull request enables an optional signal for when the mouse is hovering. This can be used to create interactive text within the RichTextLabel.

One example: http://i.imgur.com/mL9spc8.png

data.title: Added application/fat_bits property for EditorExportPlatformOSX::Edit
data.body:
orExportPlatformOSX.

This allows to export games on OSX with both 32/64 bits inside the app.

data.title: Better steam version (64 bit and examples DLC)
data.body:
I started using godot as I discovered it on steam, though I noticed only today that the steam version is the 32 bit one, even on a 64bit os.

Also it would be cool if the examples and demos that come with the steam version would be an optional dlc

data.title: Added settings to change marked and breakpoint color
data.body: Added a settings to change marked and breakpoint color in the text editor.

data.title: Hold Ctrl to turn all objects/functions into links to their help files
data.body:
I was trying to find something similar already submitted but I haven't found anything.  

So yeah

Hold Ctrl (or any other modifier key) to turn all the recognized objects or functions in the current script to links to their respective help classes. Also optionally   it should even autoscroll the help file to where the entry is located.

Additionally when hovering over recognized objects/functions it should show the help file description as a tooltip. 

Some IDEs have the ability to do this and I always found it quite useful. 

Alternatively simply tries to turn only the keyword the mouse is over rather than ALL keywords. Might be easier to implement and equally useful.
